alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 10:56PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 1130 PM MST... At 1056 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Magma, or near Florence, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Queen Creek, Magma and San Tan Valley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 206 and 209. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 136 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
